sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import { useParams, Link } from 'react-router-dom'; import { motion } from 'framer-motion'; const Post = () => { const { id } = useParams(); // In a real application, you would fetch the post data based on the ID // For now, we'll use placeholder content const post = { title: `Blog Post #${id}`, date: 'June 2025', author: 'Pearlson Team', category: 'Education', content: ` This is a placeholder for the full content of the blog post with ID ${id}. In a real application, this content would be fetched from a database or API. The post would include: - Detailed information about the topic - Images and media - Related resources - Author information - Comments section `, }; return (
{/* Hero Section */}

{post.title}

{post.date} • By {post.author} • {post.category}
{/* Content Section */}

{post.content}

{/* Back to Blog Link */}
Back to Blog
); }; export default Post;
